results.title: The Company of strangers [DVD]
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, David Wilson and Cynthia Scott
results.brief_description: A bus breaks down in the wilderness. Eight elderly women, average age 71, are stranded at a deserted farmhouse. They have only their wits, their memories, and eventually some roasted frogs’ legs, to sustain them. Through the long days and nights this remarkable group of strangers share their life stories and exchange intimate thoughts; turning the crisis into a magical time of humour and spirit. Featuring non-professional actors and spontaneous dialogue, this memorable film dissolves the barrier between fiction and reality, weaving a heartwarming tale of friendship and courage. Cast: Cissy Meddings, Mary Meigs, Catherine Roche, Michelle Sweeney, Beth Webber, Alice Diabo, Constance Garneau, Winifred Holden. Script, Gloria Demers, Cynthia Scott, David Wilson and Sally Bochner. Cinematography, David de Volpi. Music, Marie Bernard. Editing, David Wilson.

results.title: The Commitments
results.creator_credit: Sovereign Pictures, Roger Randall-Cutler, Lynda Myles and Allan Parker
results.brief_description: Alan Parker’s tale of an Irish working class band’s odyssey is a strident belt-you-in-the-mouth delight. On a mission to bring soul to Dublin plus fame and fortune for himself, Jimmy Rabbitte transforms a motley bunch of misfits and raw talent into ‘the hardest working band in the world’, THE COMMITMENTS, billing them as the ‘saviours of Soul’. Based on the cult novel by Roddy Doyle and set to a scorching soul soundtrack. This film pulsates with raw energy, colourful dialogue, working class struggles and big time dreams - it’s a knockout.

results.title: The Comancheros (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: Twentieth Century-Fox Film Corporation, George Sherman and Michael Curtiz
results.brief_description: A member of the legendary Texas Rangers works undercover to foil a notorious gang of outlaws in this top-notch Western. John Wayne stars as the two-fisted Ranger heading a cast that includes Stuart Whitman and Lee Marvin. The last film directed by Michael Curtiz “The Comancheros” is a lively, riotous Western with some exciting action sequences. Based on the novel by Paul I. Wellman.

results.title: The Color purple
results.creator_credit: Warner Bros Pictures, Amblin Entertainment, Steven Spielberg, Kathleen Kennedy, Frank Marshall and Quincy Jones
results.brief_description: Alice Walker’s joyous Pulitzer Prize winning novel comes to the screen as one of Steven Spielberg’s most powerful personal films. This enthralling story begins in a small Georgia town in 1906, when young Celie, hardly more than a child herself, gives birth to two children, fathered by the man she calls “Pa” and who takes the infants from her at birth and tells her nothing of their fate. Sustained by a close bond with her sister Nettie, Celie submerges her own identity as she is mistreated by every man in her life. This film covers the gamut of joy, sorrow, loss and reunion. It is truly unforgettable and the ending is an inspirational triumph. Stars Danny Glover, Adolph Caesar, Margaret Avery, Rae Dawn Chong, introducing Whoopi Goldberg as Celie and Oprah Winfrey as Sofia.

results.title: The Colditz story
results.creator_credit: British Lion Films, Ivan Foxwell and Guy Hamilton
results.brief_description: The Germans believed that no man could escape form Colditz Castle, set as it was in the heart of the Reich, 400 miles from any neutral frontier. This film tells the story of how the British, French, Dutch and Polish prisoners of war who were incarcerated in Colditz set out to prove their captors wrong. Starring John Mills and Eric Portman. Based on the novel “The Colditz story” by P.R. Reid.

results.title: The Coca-Cola Kid
results.creator_credit: Sylvie Le Clezio, David Roe and Dusan Makavejev
results.brief_description: Droll, sometimes wacky comedy in which an American representative from the multi-national soft-drink company of the title heads for Australia to establish his company’s product as the beverage of choice and along the way ends up finding the road to success filled with obstacles that include a passionate romance. Stars Greta Scacchi and Eric Roberts. Cinematography by Dean Semler. Based on the Frank Moorhouse novel. Rated: M

results.title: The Client
results.creator_credit: Monarchy Enterprises B. V., Warner Bros Pictures, Arnon Milchan, Steven Reuther and Joel Schumacher
results.brief_description: Mark Sway, an 11 year old trailer park kid (Brad Renfro) witnesses the suicide of a Mafia lawyer, who confesses that the Mob was behind the murder of a U.S. senator. Mark’s brother is traumatized into a coma by the incident and soon Mark finds himself torn between what he knows and what he can never tell. Gangster Barry Muldano (Anthony LaPaglia) is on Mark’s trail, and in desperation Mark arrives at the office of recovering alcoholic lawyer Reggie Love (Susan Sarandon). With the Mob after them, and a ruthless federal attorney (Tommy Lee Jones) trying to force Mark to reveal what he knows, Love battles to guarantee the safety of her client and his family. Based on the novel by John Grisham. Music by Howard Shore.

results.title: The Claim
results.creator_credit: United Artists Corporation, Andrew Eaton and Michael Winterbottom
results.brief_description: Directed by Michael Winterbottom (Butterfly kiss, Wonderland, 24 hour party people), “The Claim” is an adaptation of the Thomas Hardy novel “The Mayor of Casterbridge”. Set in the frontier town Kingdom Come, California, in the year 1867, “The Claim” plots the story of Daniel Dillon played by Peter Mullan (My name is Joe), a man who has amassed a fortune in mining and is the unofficial ruler the town. One day three people arrive in Kingdom Come who will upset Dillon’s world. Two are the wife (Natassja Kinski) and child (Sarah Polley) that he sold in a Faustian pact twenty years earlier in exchange his first gold claim, from which all his fortunes spilled. The other is a stranger, Dalglish (Wes Bentley), a land surveyor for the railroad who is seeking a path for the train line. Dalglish’s decision will determine the future of the town and Dillon, accustomed to getting his own way, seeks to sway the decision in his favour. Shot in Alberta, Canada, “The Claim” is a magnificent looking film that portrays frontier life as rudimentary, dangerous and lawless. Milla Jovovich also stars as a bar room singer, romantically invlolved with Dillon. Features a score by Michael Nyman.

results.title: The City of women = La Citta delle donne
results.creator_credit: Opera Film Produzione, Gaumont-British Instructional and Federico Fellini
results.brief_description: When Snaporaz (Marcello Mastroianni) follows an attractive woman off a train she leads him into the midst of a feminist seminar. So begins a fantastic journey as Mastroianni’s Don Juan finds himself meeting a bizarre coterie of female characters. In “La citta delle donne” Fellini confronts feminism in all its guises. Fellini is at once self-critical and indulgent but, as usual, his wonderful sense of fantasy makes this an enjoyable film to watch. In Italian with English subtitles. Note:During last 10 minutes of film some white lines may appear on screen. Adjust tracking on video player.

results.title: The City of the dead = Horror hotel
results.creator_credit: Vulcan Film (UK), Donald Taylor and John Moxey
results.brief_description: A young college student, intrigued by the historical practices of witchcraft conducted in the 17th century, travels to a small town for further investigation. There she meets a mysterious end, leaving her brother and boyfriend to uncover the truth about the town’s malevolent inhabitants. Filmed in black and white, and released the same year as Hitchcock’s “Psycho”, this horror tale is suitably menacing, relying very little on special effects, but more on atmosphere and a chilling narrative. Also known as “Horror hotel”.
